content:
All Address Books is not an address book like the others, but with the others' contacts. It's basically a result of a search of the address books (even though it's possible to search it itself).

You could create a new address book 'All Contacts', then copy contacts from the other books by drag and drop, while holding Ctrl. Ctrl+A to select all contacts in a book.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Non risultano problemi generali di questo tipo, almeno per quanto ne so. Che dimensione ha il tuo archivio di posta sul disco locale? In particolare quanti messaggi ci sono in Posta in arrivo?

Più in generale, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

Come se il problema fosse durante il primo download 7. uso solo windows defender

creator: sasgescon

content:
Decisamente troppo. Specie se le mail sono tutte in poche cartelle.

Se vuoi velocizzare Thunderbird il primo passo è suddividere la posta in un numero maggiore di cartelle in modo che ciascuna cartella non superi sul disco una dimensione di 2/4 GB.

Probabilmente al primo avvio ci si mette anche l'antivirus che dovendo controllare file molto grandi li blocca fino alla fine della scansione.

According to the following release note for Version 144.0.1: https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/144.0.1/releasenotes/ this bug has been fixed in Version 144.0.1.

Quotation from the above link:

Fixed: Message compose window was removed from Task Bar after saving as draft or template

Related bug report: Write Message compose window disappears from Task Bar when saved as draft or template https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1994411

content:
kapmet said
I click on 'show email passwords' but it doesn't show them. Instead of passwords, strange codes appear.

What is the authentication method for the account? If it's OAuth2, the entry will be a long string of letters. Same if the authentication is 'normal password' but the 'password' is an app password.
creator: sfhowes

content:
If you use Windows, there is no need to back up the Local folder. And the backup of roaming folder can be reliable done with these steps: I include both the backup and the restore:

BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed, has run at least once, and NOT running now
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
My first guess is that your Thunderbird profile has become a victim of a damaged prefs.js file. If this happens TB renames the damaged prefs.js file in prefs-1.js (or sometimes in invalidprefs.js) and creates a new virgin prefs.js file which doesn't contain any profile information. BTW your profile folder rc2jk0cq.default-release profile was not created today, but two years ago and modified today! But you're right in that it should contain all your data.

Open the rc2jk0cq.default-release profile folder and verify if it contains a small prefs.js with a size of 6 -to 7 kB and if you can find a bigger prefs-1.js file (or prefs-x.js where x is a number).
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Thanks for answering.

The rc2jk0cq.default-release profile folder contains a prefs.js file, 7 KB, created today. There are prefs-1.js all the way up to prefs-53.js, and they're all empty except for prefs-36.js which is 41 KB in size. prefs-36.js was created in 2025-01-03. Would that be the valid profile?

Should I rename prefs-36.js to prefs.js and remove the others?
creator: mvlasic27

content:
I stashed a copy of the prefs files, deleted all but the prefs-36.js, and then renamed prefs-36.js to prefs.js.

Everything is now back to normal.

Thanks for pointing me in the right direction.
creator: mvlasic27

content:
Mike Vlasic said
The rc2jk0cq.default-release profile folder contains a prefs.js file, 7 KB, created today.

This is the confirmation of my "rotten prefs.js" file diagnostic.

Mike Vlasic said
Should I rename prefs-36.js to prefs.js and remove the others?

Yes, you can try this solution, but this is a bet and most of the times it won't work. TB closed remove all prefs-xx.js files except for prefs-36.js which you rename in prefs.js, then restart TB.

If this won't work we still have the solution to re-setup all accounts, and - if you use POP - link those re-created accounts with their old correspondent account folders in the Mail folder in the Profile
creator: Mapenzi

content:
It worked and all my folders and current emails appeared. I use IMAP so that helped.

My only issue now is that my calendar is empty. I have to figure out that one.
creator: mvlasic27

content: Maybe when the prefs36.js. file was created in 2025-01-03 you did not yet use the Thunderbird calendar?
creator: Mapenzi

content: No, I'm pretty sure I was using the TB calendar at that time.

content: On the new PC click the Windows Start button. In the Search box, type: %APPDATA%\Thunderbird\ and hit Enter. content:
You're correct. Here are the steps, broken down, but the same as before:


BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed and NOT running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there

You get an A+. :) Thanks for the feedback.
creator: davidsk
